definitions.definition: the time when a baby or young animal comes out of its mother's body:

examples: The percentage of live births (= children who are born alive and continue to live) continues to increase.

definitions.definition: the position of the family into which you are born, especially its social position:
examples: He had received all the advantages of birth (= having been born into a family of a high social class) and an expensive education.

definitions.definition: born in a particular place or having parents of a particular nationality:
examples: Oscar Wilde was Irish by birth.
These asteroids were formed at the birth of the solar system.
